intro: Cypella parviflora, commonly known as the small-flowered cypella, is a flowering plant native to South America, particularly Argentina and Chile. It belongs to the Apiaceae family, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its delicate, aromatic foliage. The plant produces small, white or pale yellow flowers arranged in umbels, typical of the family. It thrives in moist, temperate climates and is often found in grassy areas or along stream banks. Due to its ornamental value and medicinal properties, it is occasionally cultivated in gardens.
